field.name: Institutional name - person
field.definition: the institution or organization that a person is affiliated with

dos.practice: This is a required field if affiliation information is being added.
This field can only be repeated by adding a new affiliation tag set.
Most often used to indicate authors, editors, submitters, speakers or contributors.
May also be used to indicate interviewees or interviewers.
If the person is a non-UCAR individual, it is not necessary to complete individual affiliation information.
Use the controlled vocabulary or enter a new institutional name.
Before using a new name, be sure to check the controlled vocabulary list carefully before entering the new institutional name.
Spell out new names completely, capitalizing all proper names and all major words.
If an external institutional name is provided already, double check for accuracy.

donts.practice: Do not use this field for meeting sponsor or publisher unless an individual, rather than an institution, is really playing that role.

examples.practice: UCAR: University Corporation for Atmospheric Research (UCAR)

otherPractice.header: Special Characters to Encode? Do This:
otherPractice.practice: All special characters like subscripts, superscripts, copyright and other symbols must be entity encoded numerically. See the numeric entity encodings.
